meanings.definition: To put in a position where one is forced to make a disadvantageous move.
meanings.sent1: She endplayed her opponent by blocking all their escape routes.
meanings.sent2: The chess master endplayed his rival into a checkmate.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox endplayed the hunter by leading him into a dead-end.
meanings.sent4: The cunning spy endplayed the security guards and slipped away unnoticed.
meanings.sent5: The maze endplayed the participants, leaving them confused and lost.

meanings.definition: To maneuver an opponent into a position where they have no good options.
meanings.sent1: He endplayed his rival into a corner with no way out.
meanings.sent2: The tricky player endplayed his opponent into a difficult decision.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat endplayed the dog into a playful chase around the yard.
meanings.sent4: The skilled negotiator endplayed the other party into accepting the deal.
meanings.sent5: The clever strategist endplayed the enemy into a trap they couldn't escape from.

meanings.definition: To outmaneuver someone in a game or situation.
meanings.sent1: She endplayed her friend in the game of chess with a surprising move.
meanings.sent2: The team endplayed their opponents with a well-coordinated strategy.
meanings.sent3: The siblings endplayed each other in a friendly competition.
meanings.sent4: The detective endplayed the suspect into confessing the truth.
meanings.sent5: The skilled pilot endplayed the enemy planes and emerged victorious.
